defs.docs:
This is a Rust implementation of the [bip39][bip39-standard] standard for Bitcoin HD wallet
 mnemonic phrases.

attributes.value: / This is a Rust implementation of the [bip39][bip39-standard] standard for Bitcoin HD wallet
/ /// create a new randomly generated mnemonic phrase
/ // get the HD wallet seed as raw bytes
/ // print the HD wallet seed as a hex string
error("invalid number of words in phrase: {0}")
error("invalid entropy length {0}bits for mnemonic type {1:?}")

defs.name: ErrorKind
defs.value:
pub enum ErrorKind {
    InvalidChecksum,
    InvalidWord,
    InvalidKeysize(usize),
    InvalidWordLength(usize),
    InvalidEntropyLength(usize, MnemonicType),
}

defs.name: Language
defs.value:
pub enum Language {
    English,
    ChineseSimplified,
    ChineseTraditional,
    French,
    Italian,
    Japanese,
    Korean,
    Spanish,
}
defs.docs:
The language determines which words will be used in a mnemonic phrase, but also indirectly
 determines the binary value of each word when a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] is turned into a [`Seed`][Seed].

attributes.value: / The language determines which words will be used in a mnemonic phrase, but also indirectly
/ determines the binary value of each word when a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] is turned into a [`Seed`][Seed].
/ These are not of much use right now, and may even be removed from the crate, as there is no
/ official language specified by the standard except English.

defs.name: from_language_code
defs.docs:
Construct a word list from its language code. Returns None
 if the language code is not valid or not supported.

attributes.value: / Construct a word list from its language code. Returns None
/ if the language code is not valid or not supported.

defs.name: wordmap
defs.docs: Get a [`WordMap`][WordMap] that allows word -> index lookups in the word list

attributes.value: / Get a [`WordMap`][WordMap] that allows word -> index lookups in the word list
/ The index of an individual word in the word list is used as the binary value of that word
/ when the phrase is turned into a [`Seed`][Seed].

defs.name: Mnemonic
defs.docs: The primary type in this crate, most tasks require creating or using one.

attributes.value: / The primary type in this crate, most tasks require creating or using one.
/ To create a *new* [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] from a randomly generated key, call [`Mnemonic::new()`][Mnemonic::new()].
/ To get a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] instance for an existing mnemonic phrase, including
/ those generated by other software or hardware wallets, use [`Mnemonic::from_phrase()`][Mnemonic::from_phrase()].
/ You can get the HD wallet [`Seed`][Seed] from a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] by calling [`Seed::new()`][Seed::new()].
/ From there you can either get the raw byte value with [`Seed::as_bytes()`][Seed::as_bytes()], or the hex
/ You can also get the original entropy value back from a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] with [`Mnemonic::entropy()`][Mnemonic::entropy()],
/ but beware that the entropy value is **not the same thing** as an HD wallet seed, and should
/ [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] implements [`Zeroize`][Zeroize], so it's bytes will be zeroed when it's dropped.

defs.name: MnemonicType
defs.value:
pub enum MnemonicType {
    Words12 = ,
    Words15 = ,
    Words18 = ,
    Words21 = ,
    Words24 = ,
}
defs.docs: Determines the number of words that will be present in a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] phrase

attributes.value: / Determines the number of words that will be present in a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] phrase
/ Also directly affects the amount of entropy that will be used to create a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic],
/ and therefore the cryptographic strength of the HD wallet keys/addresses that can be derived from
/ For example, a 12 word mnemonic phrase is essentially a friendly representation of a 128-bit key,
/ while a 24 word mnemonic phrase is essentially a 256-bit key.
/ If you know you want a specific phrase length, you can use the enum variant directly, for example
/ You can also get a `MnemonicType` that corresponds to one of the standard BIP39 key sizes by

defs.name: for_word_count
defs.docs: Get a `MnemonicType` for a mnemonic phrase with a specific number of words

attributes.value: / Get a `MnemonicType` for a mnemonic phrase with a specific number of words
/ Specifying a word count not provided for by the BIP39 standard will return an `Error`

defs.name: for_key_size
defs.docs: Get a `MnemonicType` for a mnemonic phrase representing the given key size as bits

attributes.value: / Get a `MnemonicType` for a mnemonic phrase representing the given key size as bits
/ Specifying a key size not provided for by the BIP39 standard will return an `Error`

defs.name: for_phrase
defs.docs: Get a `MnemonicType` for an existing mnemonic phrase

attributes.value: / Get a `MnemonicType` for an existing mnemonic phrase
/ This can be used when you need information about a mnemonic phrase based on the number of
/ words, for example you can get the entropy value using [`MnemonicType::entropy_bits`][MnemonicType::entropy_bits()].
/ Specifying a phrase that does not match one of the standard BIP39 phrase lengths will return
/ an `Error` of kind `ErrorKind::InvalidWordLength`. The phrase will not be validated in any
/ let test_mnemonic = "park remain person kitchen mule spell knee armed position rail grid ankle";

defs.name: Seed
defs.docs: The secret value used to derive HD wallet addresses from a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] phrase.

attributes.value: / The secret value used to derive HD wallet addresses from a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] phrase.
/ Because it is not possible to create a [`Mnemonic`][Mnemonic] instance that is invalid, it is
/ therefore impossible to have a [`Seed`][Seed] instance that is invalid. This guarantees that only
/ a valid, intact mnemonic phrase can be used to derive HD wallet addresses.
/ To get the raw byte value use [`Seed::as_bytes()`][Seed::as_bytes()]. These can be used to derive
/ HD wallet addresses using another crate (deriving HD wallet addresses is outside the scope of this
/ [`Seed`][Seed] implements [`Zeroize`][Zeroize], so it's bytes will be zeroed when it's dropped.
